description: With a wonderful view overlooking Sooke Basin, the summit is favoured by hikers and bikers. On a clear day, Port Angeles is visible. Since this IS a hill route, expect steep inclines which can become slick when wet. In summer, pack water!
directions: At the intersection of Hwy 14 and Otter Point Road, turn north and proceed to Burr Rd.Left on Petemar, then right on Blanchard. Parking at the end of Blanchard.Alternate start point - start at William Simmons Park on Otter Point Rd. Follow trail behind CRD building towards the forest for 300 metres. Markers on trees at the entrance to forest.
title: Broom Hill Summit
